qas.question: LaserDisc was the first format to provide what type of releases to consumers?
What was the first "Special Edition" film to be released to home video?

answers.text: the 1984 Criterion Collection edition of Citizen Kane

qas.question: What bonus features were available on the first home video "Special Edition"?

answers.text: interviews, commentary tracks, documentaries, still photographs

qas.question: What feature, unique to LaserDisc, made bonus content possible?

context: LaserDisc's <a3_0>support for multiple audio tracks<a3_0/> allowed for vast supplemental materials to be included on-disc and made it the first available format for <a0_0>"Special Edition"<a0_0/> releases; <a1_0>the 1984 Criterion Collection edition of Citizen Kane<a1_0/> is generally credited as being the first "Special Edition" release to home video,[citation needed] and for setting the standard by which future SE discs were measured. The disc provided <a2_0>interviews, commentary tracks, documentaries, still photographs<a2_0/>, and other features for historians and collectors.
